snippet: Higher taxes, wage freezes and spending cuts are not the answers to Europe’s economic malaise.
abstract: Editorial contends that European leaders, especially those in Germany, must relent in their pursuit of austerity measures threatening to choke off pension benefits and economic growth in Spain at the time when they are most needed; argues Germany's demand that Spain institute further cuts before receiving recapitalization from a new banking union is particularly short-sighted.
lead_paragraph: Higher taxes, wage freezes and spending cuts are not the answers to Europe’s economic malaise.
